sen.j: 北近畿（きたきんき）とは、西日本旅客鉄道が新大阪駅～福知山駅・豊岡駅 (兵庫県)・城崎温泉駅間を福知山線（JR宝塚線）・山陰本線経由で運行するエル特急の名称である。
sen.e: Kitakinki is the name of a "L-tokkyu (limited express)," operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West), which runs in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Kinosakionsen Station via Fukuchiyama Station & Toyooka Station (in Hyogo Prefecture) on the track of Fukuchiyama Line (also called as JR Takarazuka Line) & San'in Main Line.

Kitakinki, an "L-tokkyu (limited express)" operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), runs in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Kinosakionsen Station via Fukuchiyama Station and Toyooka Station (in Hyogo Prefecture) on the track of the Fukuchiyama Line (also called the JR Takarazuka Line) and San'in Main Line.

Kitakinki, an "L-tokkyu (limited express)" operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), runs in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Kinosakionsen Station via Fukuchiyama Station and Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture) on the track of the Fukuchiyama Line (also called the JR Takarazuka Line) and Sanin Main Line.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、sanin としました。

sen.j: 北近畿ビッグXネットワークを形成する列車の1つである。
sen.e: The service of Kitakinki is part of "Kitakinki Big X Network,"which is the name of the limited express service network in Northern Kinki District that connects Kitakinki Tango Railway with JR West, and "Big X" comes from its shape like the letter "X" on the map.
sen.cmt: 「北近畿ビッグXネットワーク」は説明を要する箇所ですが、Wiki の該当ページを参照の上「JR西日本と北近畿タンゴ鉄道を結ぶ近畿地方北部の特急ネットワークに付けられた名前で、その形状が地図で見るとXの文字に似ていることに由来する」としました（2行目の which 以下）。
sen.e: The Kitakinki service is part of "Kitakinki Big X Network," which is the name of the limited-express service network in the northern Kinki District that connects Kitakinki Tango Railway with JR West; the name "Big X" comes from its shape, which is like the letter "X" on the map.

The Kitakinki service is part of "Kitakinki Big X Network," which is the name of the limited-express service network in the northern Kinki District that connects Kitakinki Tango Railway with JR West; the name "Big X" comes from its shape, which is like the letter "X" on the map.

sen.j: 運行概要
sen.e: Summary of the operation
Summary of the operation
Summary of the operation

sen.j: 大阪方面からは、さんたん（丹波・丹後・但馬）地区への観光特急の色合いを持っており、特に冬場は毎年運行されている「カニカニ日帰りエクスプレス」キャンペーンの一環で利用客が増える。
sen.e: When going from the direction of Osaka for "Santan (Tanba, Tango and Tajima)" areas, train service of Kitakinki functions as the sightseeing limited express, and the number of the passengers increases especially during the wintertime as a result of the promotion of "Day Trip by Limited Express for All-You-Can-Eat Crabs," which is carried on every winter.

When going from the direction of Osaka for the "Santan (Tanba, Tango and Tajima)" area, the Kitakinki train service functions as a sightseeing limited express, and the number of passengers increases especially during the wintertime as a result of the promotion of "Day Trip by Limited Express for All-You-Can-Eat Crabs," which is held every winter.

When going from the direction of Osaka for the "Santan (Tanba, Tango and Tajima)" area, the Kitakinki train service functions as a sightseeing limited express, and the number of passengers increases especially during the wintertime as a result of the promotion of 'kanikani Higaeri Express (Day Trip by Limited Express for All-You-Can-Eat Crabs),' which is held every winter.
sen.cmt: カニカニ日帰りエクスプレス を追加し、補足を括弧にしました。Tamba→Tanbaに変更しました。

sen.j: また、福知山駅以南は福知山線の通勤特急的な要素もあり特に篠山口駅～福知山駅間は普通列車の本数が少ない関係でこまめに停まる列車もある。
sen.e: And when running in the section from Fukuchiyama Station and southward, train service of Kitakinki on Fukuchiyama Line also functions as the commuter limited express, and especially within the section between Sasayamaguchi Station and Fukuchiyama Station, where the number of the local train is few, some trains of Kitakinki make a stop at every station.

When running in the section from Fukuchiyama Station southward, the Kitakinki train service on the Fukuchiyama Line functions as a commuter limited express, and particularly within the section between Sasayamaguchi Station and Fukuchiyama Station, where there are few local trains, some trains of Kitakinki stop at every station.

When running in the section from Fukuchiyama Station southward, the Kitakinki train service on the Fukuchiyama Line functions as a commuter limited express, and particularly within the section between Sasayamaguchi Station and Fukuchiyama Station, where there are few local trains, some trains of Kitakinki makes stops at many station.
sen.cmt: 「こまめに停まる」をmakes stops at many stationsとしました。

sen.j: 城崎温泉・豊岡・福知山方面からは、平日はビジネス特急、会社休業日は観光特急の両面があり、4両から7両編成と幅が大きい。
sen.e: When coming from the direction of Kinosakionsen Station, Toyooka Station and Fukuchiyama Station for Osaka, train service of Kitakinki not only functions as the limited express for business trip on weekdays, but also functions as the limited express for sightseeing on weekends & holidays, so the number of the train cars varies from 4 to 7 depending on what date you get on it.

When coming from the direction of Kinosakionsen Station, Toyooka Station and Fukuchiyama Station for Osaka, the Kitakinki train service not only functions as a limited express for business trip on weekdays but also as a limited express for sightseeing on weekends and holidays, so the number of train cars varies from four to seven depending on the day of boarding.

When coming from the direction of Kinosakionsen Station, Toyooka Station and Fukuchiyama Station for Osaka, the Kitakinki train service not only functions as a limited express for business trip on weekdays but also as a limited express for sightseeing on weekends and holidays, so the number of train cars varies from four to seven depending on the day of boarding.

sen.j: また、福知山で「たんば (列車)」に連絡する列車があり、本数が少ない京都方面～但馬方面直通の「きのさき (列車)」の代わりとなっている。
sen.e: And some trains of Kitakinki connect with those of "Tanba" at Fukuchiyama Station, thereby functioning as the substitute for "Kinosaki" which directly connects Kyoto area with Tajima area but has few number of trains.

Some trains of the Kitakinki service connect with those of "Tanba" at Fukuchiyama Station, thereby functioning as substitutes for "Kinosaki," which directly connects the Kyoto area with the Tajima area but has fewer trains.

Some trains of the Kitakinki service connect with those of 'Tanba (train)' at Fukuchiyama Station, thereby functioning as substitutes for 'Kinosaki (train),' which directly connects the Kyoto area with the Tajima area but has fewer trains.
sen.cmt: たんば＝tambaとしました（JRではtambaという表記のようです）Tamba→Tanbaに変更しました。

sen.j: ちなみに、福知山駅で改札口を出ずに乗り換えると、特例により通しの特急料金で乗れる。
sen.e: In addition, if you change trains at Fukuchiyama Station without going out of its ticket gate, your limited express charge is exceptionally discounted as that of a through train.
Additionally, if one changes trains at Fukuchiyama Station without passing through its ticket gate, the limited express charge is exceptionally discounted as that of a through train.
Additionally, if one changes trains at Fukuchiyama Station without passing through its ticket gate, the limited express charge is exceptionally discounted as that of a through train.

sen.j: 特急列車が運転されるサイクルには大阪発着の快速列車は運転されない。
sen.e: When the limited express is running on the track of Fukuchiyama Line or San'in Main Line, there is no operation of the rapid train starting form and arriving at Osaka Station.
When the limited express is running on the track of the Fukuchiyama Line or the San'in Main Line, there is no operation of the rapid train starting from and arriving at Osaka Station.
When the limited express is running on the track of the Fukuchiyama Line or the Sanin Main Line, there is no operation of the rapid train arriving at and departing from Osaka Station.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、sanin としました。"starting from and arriving at"→"arriving at and departing from"に変更しました。

sen.j: また快速との所要時間が大きくないために三田以南ではいわばホームライナー的な要素も持っている（三田以南で通過する快速停車駅は西宮名塩駅・中山寺駅・川西池田駅・伊丹駅 (JR西日本)のみ）。
sen.e: Taking almost the same time to cover the railway section as the rapid train, train service of Kitakinki also functions like "Home Liner" (the train whose number of passengers is fixed mainly for securing the seat for all of them during the commute hours) when running in the section from Sanda Station and southward; in this section, they make a stop at every station that the rapid train stops by, except for Nishinomiyanajio Station, Nakayamadera Station, Kawanishiikeda Station and Itami Station (of JR West).
sen.cmt: 「ホームライナー」とは「通勤時間帯に全ての乗客が着席できるようにすることを主目的として定員制限のなされる列車」（Wiki 「ホームライナー」参照）であり、左の3行目から5行目にかけての括弧の中はこれを表現しています。
sen.e: Because it takes nearly the same time to cover the railway section as the rapid train, the Kitakinki train service also functions like the "Home Liner" (a train whose number of passengers is fixed mainly for securing seats for all of them during the commute hours) when running in the section from Sanda Station and southward; in this section they stop at every station at which the rapid train stops, except for Nishinomiyanajio Station, Nakayamadera Station, Kawanishiikeda Station and Itami Station (of JR West).

Because it takes nearly the same time to cover the railway section as the rapid train, the Kitakinki train service also functions like the "Home Liner" (a train whose number of passengers is fixed mainly for securing seats for all of them during the commute hours) when running in the section from Sanda Station and southward; in this section they stop at every station at which the rapid train stops, except for Nishinomiyanajio Station, Nakayamadera Station, Kawanishiikeda Station and Itami Station (of JR West).

sen.j: 城崎温泉系統を中心とした一部の列車では、車内販売も行われている。
sen.e: There are sales in some trains of Kitakinki, mainly those starting from or arriving at Kinosakionsen Station.
There are sales in some trains of the Kitakinki service, mainly those that start from or arrive at Kinosakionsen Station.
There are sales in some trains of the Kitakinki service, mainly those that arrive at or depart from Kinosakionsen Station.

sen.j: 1980年代末期に舞鶴自動車道（現：舞鶴若狭自動車道）が開通した頃は、大阪～福知山間にハイウェイバス（西日本JRバス・神姫バスによる運行）が設定されていたが、本数が少ないことや、利用が低迷していたため、数年で廃止されている。
sen.e: When Maizuru Expressway (the present Maizuru Wakasa Expressway) had opened in the late 1980s, the expressway bus service had been operated (by West JR Bus Company and Shinki Bus) in the section between Osaka and Fukuchiyama, but their operation was ended several years later because the number of bus services & passengers was low.

When the Maizuru Expressway (the present Maizuru Wakasa Expressway) opened in the late 1980s, the expressway bus service was operated (by West JR Bus Company and Shinki Bus) in the section between Osaka and Fukuchiyama, but the operation was ended several years later because the number of bus services and passengers was low.

When the Maizuru Expressway (the present Maizuru Wakasa Expressway) opened in the late 1980s, the expressway bus service was operated (by West JR Bus Company and Shinki Bus) in the section between Osaka and Fukuchiyama, but the operation was ended several years later because the number of bus services and passengers was low.

sen.cmt: オリジナルの文意につき以下のように解した上で訳しています。「1988年7月16日、『北近畿』の1往復の車両に『エーデル丹後』の車両、すなわち国鉄キハ65形気動車の連結が開始されたが、この『エーデル丹後』は北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線直通特急であった。」
sen.e: On July 16, 1988, "Kitakinki" began to have its rolling stock of round-trip service connected with that of "Edel-Tango," meaning the JNR/JR diesel car Type Kiha 65, and the "Edel-Tango" was the limited express through to the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).

July 16, 1988: 'Kitakinki' began to have its rolling stock of round-trip service connected with that of 'Edel-Tango,' meaning the JNR/JR diesel car Type Kiha 65, and the 'Edel-Tango' was the limited express through to the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR).

sen.j: 運行区間は、大阪駅～天橋立駅間とした。
sen.e: The operation section was between Osaka Station and Amanohashidate Station.
The operating section was between Osaka Station and Amanohashidate Station.
The operating section was between Osaka Station and Amanohashidate Station.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）3月11日、「北近畿」の内1往復を延長する形で国鉄キハ65形気動車による特急「エーデル鳥取」（- とっとり）を運行開始。
sen.e: On March 11, 1989, Limited Express "Edel-Tottori" began to be operated in the running section extended westward from that of a round-trip service of "Kitakinki," and the rolling stock of "Edel-Tottori" was JNR/JR Diesel Cars Type Kiha 65.
sen.cmt: オリジナルの文意につき以下のように解した上で訳しています。「1989年3月11日、特急『エーデル鳥取』が、それまで『北近畿』の1往復便が走行していた区間を含めより西方に延長された区間の運行を開始し、その車両は国鉄キハ65形気動車だった。」
sen.e: On March 11, 1989, the limited express "Edel-Tottori" started operating in the running section extended westward from that of a round-trip service of "Kitakinki," and the rolling stock of "Edel-Tottori" was JNR/JR diesel car Type Kiha 65.

March 11, 1989: The Limited Express 'Edel-Tottori' started operating in the running section extended westward from that of a round-trip service of 'Kitakinki,' and the rolling stock of 'Edel-Tottori' was JNR/JR diesel car Type Kiha 65.

sen.j: 運行区間は、大阪駅～倉吉駅間。
sen.e: The operation section was between Osaka Station and Kurayoshi Station.
The operating section was between Osaka Station and Kurayoshi Station.
The operating section was between Osaka Station and Kurayoshi Station.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）3月10日、「北近畿」2往復を国鉄キハ65形気動車による「エーデル北近畿」（- きたきんき）運行開始。
sen.e: On March 10, 1990, "Edel-Kitakinki" began to be operated in the running section extended westward from that of two round-trip services of "Kitakinki," and the rolling stock of "Edel-Kitakinki" was JNR/JR Diesel Cars Type Kiha 65.
sen.cmt: オリジナルの一行目、「2往復を」のあとに「延長する形で」と補って訳しています。（こう補うと、ほぼセル181Bと同一の形式の文章になるからです。）
sen.e: On March 10, 1990, "Edel-Kitakinki" started operating in the running section extended westward from that of the two round-trip services of "Kitakinki," and the rolling stock of "Edel-Kitakinki" was JNR/JR diesel car Type Kiha 65.

March 10, 1990: 'Edel-Kitakinki' started operating in the running section extended westward from that of the two round-trip services of 'Kitakinki,' and the rolling stock of 'Edel-Kitakinki' was JNR/JR diesel car Type Kiha 65.

sen.j: 運行区間は、大阪駅～浜坂駅間とした。
sen.e: The operation section was between Osaka Station and Hamasaka Station.
The operating section was between Osaka Station and Hamasaka Station.
The operating section was between Osaka Station and Hamasaka Station.

sen.j: 1991年（平成3年）12月、大阪駅～城崎駅間を運行する臨時急行列車として「きのさき」が運行される。
sen.e: In December of 1991, "Kinosaki" began to be operated as the special express running in the section between Osaka Station and Kinosaki Station.
In December of 1991, "Kinosaki" started operating as a special express running in the section between Osaka Station and Kinosaki Station.
December, 1991: 'Kinosaki' started operating as a special express running in the section between Osaka Station and Kinosaki Station.

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）、舞鶴線東舞鶴駅まで「エーデル北近畿」延長。
sen.e: In 1992, the operation section of "Edel-Kitakinki" was extended to Higashi-Maizuru Station on Maizuru Line.
In 1992, the operating section of "Edel-Kitakinki" was extended to Higashi-Maizuru Station on the Maizuru Line.
1992: The operating section of 'Edel-Kitakinki' was extended to Higashi-Maizuru Station on the Maizuru Line.

sen.j: 福知山駅で東舞鶴駅発着列車と浜坂駅発着列車との分割・併結を行う。
sen.e: At Fukuchiyama Station, the rolling stock division & connection was done between the train starting from & arriving at Higashi-Maizuru Station and the train starting from & arriving at Hamasaka Station.

At Fukuchiyama Station, the division and connection of rolling stock was done between the train starting from and arriving at Higashi-Maizuru Station and the train starting from and arriving at Hamasaka Station.

At Fukuchiyama Station, the division and connection of rolling stock was done between the train arriving at and departing from and Higashi-Maizuru Station and the train arriving at and departing from Hamasaka Station.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）12月3日、「エーデル鳥取」運行区間を鳥取駅までに短縮。
sen.e: On December 3, 1994, "Edel-Tottori" had its operation section shortened to Tottori Station.
On December 3, 1994, "Edel-Tottori" had its operating section shortened to Tottori Station.
December 3, 1994: 'Edel-Tottori' had its operating section shortened to Tottori Station.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）12月、「きのさき」運行を終了。
sen.e: In December of 1995, the operation of "Kinosaki" was ended.
In December of 1995, the operation of "Kinosaki" ceased.
December, 1995: The operation of 'Kinosaki' ceased.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月16日、ダイヤ改正に伴い以下のように変更。
sen.e: On March 16, 1996, the timetable was revised, and the high-class train operation was changed accordingly as follows.

sen.j: 「北近畿」全定期列車を新大阪駅発着とする。
sen.e: All regular trains of "Kitakinki" were made to start from and arrive at Shin-Osaka Station.
All regular trains of "Kitakinki" would start from and arrive at Shin-Osaka Station.
All regular trains of 'Kitakinki' would arrive at and depart from and Shin-Osaka Station.

sen.j: 「北近畿」のヘッドマークをエル特急ロゴを貼付した「運行地域である近畿北部に飛翔するコウノトリ」のイラストから、現行のものに変更になる。
sen.e: The emblem of "Kitakinki" on the front car changed from the picture (a stork soaring in the sky of Northern Kinki, the running section of the train), which was affixed the L-tokkyu logo, to the present one.

The emblem of "Kitakinki" on the front car changed from the picture (a stork soaring in the sky of northern Kinki, the running section of the train), to which was affixed the L-tokkyu logo, to the present design.

The emblem of 'Kitakinki' on the front car changed from the picture (a stork soaring in the sky of northern Kinki, the running section of the train), to which was affixed the L-tokkyu logo, to the present design.

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線電化に伴い、急行「みやづ」を特急「文殊 (列車)」に格上げ。
sen.e: With the electrification of KTR Miyafuku Line, Express "Miyazu" was upgraded to Limited Express "Monju."
With the electrification of the KTR Miyafuku Line, the express "Miyazu" was upgraded to the limited express "Monju."
With the electrification of the KTR Miyafuku Line, the Express 'Miyazu' was upgraded to the Limited Express 'Monju (train).'
sen.cmt: Limited Express, Express としました。 "→ ' としました。

sen.j: 「北近畿」1往復に連結の北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線直通特急を「エーデル丹後」から北近畿タンゴ鉄道所有車両の「タンゴディスカバリー」に変更。
sen.e: "Tango Discovery," which is the rolling stock owned by KTR, replaced "Edel-Tango" as the limited express that is through to KTR Miyafuku Line and is connected with the rolling stock of a round-trip service of "Kitakinki."

"Tango Discovery," which was rolling stock owned by KTR, replaced "Edel-Tango" as the limited express running through to the KTR Miyafuku Line and connected with the rolling stock of a round-trip "Kitakinki" service.

Tango Discovery,' which was rolling stock owned by KTR, replaced 'Edel-Tango' as the limited express running through to the KTR Miyafuku Line and connected with the rolling stock of a round-trip 'Kitakinki' service.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）3月8日、尼崎駅 (JR西日本)改良工事完成に伴い、「北近畿」、「文殊」、急行「だいせん」の全列車尼崎駅に停車開始する。
sen.e: On March 8, 1997, with the refinement construction of Amagasaki Station (of JR Wset) completed, all trains of Limited Express "Kitakinki" & "Monju" and Express "Daisen" began to make a stop at Amagasaki Station.

On March 8, 1997, with the refinement construction of Amagasaki Station (of JR West) completed, all trains of the limited express "Kitakinki" and "Monju" and the express "Daisen" began making stops at Amagasaki Station.

March 8, 1997: With the refinement construction of Amagasaki Station (JR West) completed, all trains of the Limited Express 'Kitakinki' and 'Monju' and the Express 'Daisen' began making stops at Amagasaki Station.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）10月2日、「エーデル鳥取」・「エーデル北近畿」運行終了。
sen.e: On October 2, 1999, the operation of "Edel-Tottori" & "Edel-Kitakinki" was ended.
On October 2, 1999, the operation of "Edel-Tottori" and "Edel-Kitakinki" ceased.
October 2, 1999: The operation of 'Edel-Tottori' and 'Edel-Kitakinki' ceased.

sen.j: また「タンゴディスカバリー」は京都駅発着となり、「北近畿」の連結も終了。
sen.e: And "Tango Discovery" was made to start from and arrive at Kyoto Station, and the connection of its rolling stock with that of "Kitakinki" was ended.
Moreover, the "Tango Discovery" would start from and arrive at Kyoto Station, and the connection of its rolling stock with that of "Kitakinki" was ended.
Moreover, the 'Tango Discovery' would arrive at and depart from Kyoto Station, and the connection of its rolling stock with that of 'Kitakinki' was ended.

sen.j: その代替として「タンゴエクスプローラー」が大阪駅発着となる。

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）10月16日、急行「だいせん」運行終了に伴い、新大阪駅～福知山駅間に「北近畿」下り1本を増発。
sen.e: On October 16, 2004, with the operation of Express "Daisen" ended, one down train of "Kitakinki" was added to the existing ones running in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama Station.

October 16, 2004: With the operation of the Express 'Daisen' ended, one outbound train of 'Kitakinki' was added to the existing ones running in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama Station.

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）4月25日、JR福知山線脱線事故が発生。
sen.e: On April 25, 2005, the train derailment accident of JR Fukuchiyama Line occurred.
On April 25, 2005, a train-derailment accident occurred on the JR Fukuchiyama Line.
April 25, 2005: A train-derailment accident occurred on the JR Fukuchiyama Line.
sen.cmt: on 日付→: に変更しました。

sen.j: 6月18日まで新大阪駅～福知山駅間が運休となる。
sen.e: Until June 18, train service was suspended in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama Station.
Until June 18, train service was suspended in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama Station.
Until June 18, train service was suspended in the section between Shin-Osaka Station and Fukuchiyama Station.

sen.j: なお、この事故の際、事故現場に新大阪発の「北近畿3号」が迫っていたが、近くの踏切の非常ボタンが押されて特殊信号発光機が点灯したため運転士が異常を察知し非常ブレーキを掛け、100m手前で停車させたため危うく難を逃れている。
sen.e: In addition, when the accident occurred, "Kitakinki No.3" from Shin-Osaka came nearby, but someone pushed the emergency button of the railway crossing near to the accident scene, so the obstruction warning indicator was on, and the train motorman sensed the abnormal situation, pulled the emergency cord, and stopped the train at the spot one hundred meters away from the site, so it narrowly escaped danger.

Additionally, when the accident occurred, "Kitakinki No. 3" from Shin-Osaka came nearby, but someone pressed the emergency button of the railway crossing near to the scene of the accident, so the obstruction warning indicator was on; the train motorman sensed the abnormal situation, pulled the emergency cord, and stopped the train at the spot just a hundred meters from the site, thus narrowly escaping danger.

Additionally, when the accident occurred, 'Kitakinki No. 3' from Shin-Osaka came nearby, but someone pressed the emergency button of the railway crossing near to the scene of the accident, so the obstruction warning indicator was on; the train motorman sensed the abnormal situation, pulled the emergency cord, and stopped the train at the spot just a hundred meters from the site, thus narrowly escaping danger.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月18日、「北近畿」・「文殊」全面禁煙化を実施。
sen.e: On March 18, 2007, the total ban of smoking was begun in cars of "Kitakinki" & "Monju."
On March 18, 2007, a total ban on smoking was implemented in the cars of "Kitakinki" and "Monju."
March 18, 2007: A total ban on smoking was implemented in the cars of 'Kitakinki' and 'Monju.'
